title: Industrial theme refresh via global tokens and layout section alignment

requirements.summary: Update global design tokens (colors, radius, shadows, typography) to a new industrial, professional palette that is not predominantly blue/purple, maintaining accessible contrast in light/dark modes.
acceptanceCriteria: Global theme tokens are updated in a single source of truth (e.g., CSS variables/Tailwind tokens) so the change applies site-wide.
Primary/secondary/accent/background/foreground/border colors are updated to a new cohesive palette and are not predominantly blue or purple.
Typography, border radius, and shadows reflect the updated theme and remain consistent across pages.
Text contrast remains readable in both light and dark modes (no low-contrast primary text on primary backgrounds).

file_operations.description: Revise the global CSS variable theme tokens for both :root and .dark (background/foreground/card/popover/primary/secondary/accent/muted/border/ring, plus charts) to a cohesive industrial palette (e.g., graphite/stone bases with warm safety accent tones) that avoids blue/purple dominance; also update global typography settings (font stack/weights/letter-spacing as needed) and the --radius token to match the new theme.

Align Tailwind extensions with the updated tokens: ensure color mappings continue to reference the CSS variables, adjust borderRadius mappings if token semantics change, and update/expand boxShadow tokens (e.g., refine shadow-construction) to match the new industrial depth without changing shadcn/ui source files.

requirements.summary: Apply the updated token-driven theme consistently across shared layout and key page sections by removing or adjusting hardcoded color classes that conflict with the new tokens.
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation active/hover states still look correct under the new theme (no clashing backgrounds/foregrounds).
Footer background, borders, and link states match the new theme and remain accessible.
Home hero section remains visually strong with the existing hero image and updated theme colors; buttons and badges remain legible.
Cards (e.g., Services/Projects) still have appropriate hover/active styling consistent with the new theme.

file_operations.description: Adjust any navigation styling that may be overly tied to the previous palette (active/hover backgrounds/foregrounds, muted usage, transparency) to rely on token-driven Tailwind colors (bg-background/bg-muted/bg-secondary etc.) so states remain legible and non-clashing under the new tokens.

Update footer container/background/border and link/hover styles to consistently use token-driven colors (muted/foreground/border/secondary) and ensure accessible contrast with the updated theme, without changing any copy or removing existing elements.

Refactor hero and CTA section styling to avoid hardcoded/old-theme-specific classes (e.g., primary-foreground alpha borders/backgrounds) and ensure Badge/Button variants and overlayed hero image remain strong and readable using the new tokens; keep existing static generated images and paths intact (including /assets/generated/hero-construction.dim_1600x800.png and /assets/generated/gov-approved-badge.dim_512x512.png).

Ensure card-heavy service grids and section backgrounds use token-driven classes (muted/background/border) and that icon accent colors remain appropriate with the updated palette; keep content unchanged aside from styling alignment.
Tune project card hover/active styling (shadow, scale, muted surfaces) so it matches the updated theme depth and token-driven colors, keeping interactions consistent and professional.

Align modal surfaces (DialogContent, image container background, any rounded/shadow usage) with updated tokens so project detail presentation matches the new theme without editing any files under frontend/src/components/ui.
